title: Single dad who scooped £250,000 on lottery wants to buy an Audi A3 - there's just one catch
text:
Single dad who scooped £250,000 on lottery wants to buy an Audi A3 - there's just one catch Andrew Nabb, 33, won a cool £247,513 in last Friday's EuroMillions draw and can't wait to get behind the wheel of his dream car   Share   Comments By Paul Britton 07:13, 11 FEB 2017 Updated 07:24, 11 FEB 2017 News Andrew Nabb, 33, won £247,513.70 (Photo: MEN SYNDICATION)   Share   Comments Get daily   A single dad who scooped nearly £250,000 on the EuroMillions is looking forward to splashing the cash on his dream car. 
Andrew Nabb, 33, won a cool £247,513 in last Friday’s National Lottery draw . 
The father-of-three is now planning get behind the wheel of his dream car - an Audi A3.
But there's just one catch - he also needs to pay for DRIVING LESSONS.
Also on his shopping list for the future is a new house and a holiday to Tenerife for his two sons and daughter, the Manchester Evening News reports . 
Read More Number's up for greedy bookies who take bets on lottery outcomes without giving to good causes The dad-of-three plans to buy an Audi (Photo: MEN SYNDICATION) Andrew, from Bury, said he was ‘over the moon’ at his win, describing it as ‘probably the best day of my life, after my children being born’.
He works in Bury as a steel fitter and said the lucky windfall couldn’t have come at a better time as he’s been ‘in and out’ of jobs for the past 12 months.
He was presented with his cheque with his mum Susan Nabb at the Bolholt Country Park Hotel in Bury.
Andrew scooped the life-changing amount of money in the EuroMillions draw (Photo: MEN SYNDICATION) “Not only is it life-changing for me – it is life-changing for my family too,” said Andrew. “The win will also enable me to pay for driving lessons and buy a car too – something I never believed I would be able to do.
“My kids are my world. I’ll do anything I can to give them a helping hand in life, starting with the perfect home to grow up in.”
Read More Shocked Lotto winner celebrated £4.3million win by going home and "sitting in dark room with cup of tea" Andrew celebrates with mum Susan Nabb (Photo: MEN SYNDICATION) Andrew bought his winning lucky dip ticket from a shop on Walmersley Road, Bury - and thought nothing more of it.
He said: “I was just doing my weekend chores and popped into my local shop for a few items and I suddenly remembered I hadn’t checked my ticket. The cashier checked the ticket, the machine made a noise and she told him to call Camelot.
“I just thought there must have been a mistake. I immediately rushed home and phoned Camelot and the lady on the end of the phone broke the best news of my life to me that I had won almost a quarter of a million pounds.
Read More Time running out for EuroMillions winner who has not claimed £1million prize after six months The 33-year-old also plans to treat his kids to a holiday (Photo: MEN SYNDICATION) “I had to ask her to keep repeating herself – I just kept thinking this cannot be true – this cannot happen to me. I didn’t know whether to scream with excitement or burst into tears. It just seemed so surreal. The win will just make life so much easier for me in so many ways.
“I’ve already passed my driving theory test and I’ve been saving up to pay for my driving lessons. Now with this win, I’ll finally be able to get behind the wheel of a car. And then hopefully buy my dream car, An Audi A3.”
His winning numbers were 3, 4, 15, 46, 50 and the Lucky Star 5.
Andrew said he has no intention of stopping playing. “I’ve won once, I can win again,” he added. “Lightning can strike twice.”
